newsitem.title: GERMANY: More grain to go into German mixed feeds - Toepfer.
newsitem.headline: More grain to go into German mixed feeds - Toepfer.

text.p: The proportion of grain used in German compound feed production in 1996/97 may rise by 700,000-800,000 tonnes from the 6.3 million used in 1995/96, grain trader Toepfer said in a monthly report.

Toepfer said grain's share in the 19.06 million tonnes of compound feed produced in 1995/96 was 33 percent but in the first five months of the 96/97 season, it had risen to 35 percent where it was expected to stay.
Direct feeding of grains on farms should also rise by the same rate, helped by higher maize and triticale crops in 1996, which are suitable for feeding.
Direct grain feeding volumes are difficult to estimate but in the last few years they were in a 14-16 million tonne range.
Germany's 1996 grain harvest has been finally set at 42.14 million tonnes by the farm ministry, up from 39.3 million in 1995 from a 6.7 million hectare area (up 2.8 percent), Toepfer also said.
